Name: If On a Rainy Night a Family
QuestDesc: The bitter night lingers for the restless. An invitation from the Montelli family pulls you into its past, where new and old, balance and change collide. In the freest place of Ragunna, the host of the invitation awaits your arrival.

Chapters.Title: Go to the Liberty Square in midnight (22:00-02:00)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The midnight chime has faded, yet the night endures. Restless hearts long for an understanding that should be ours."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "In the freest place of Ragunna, I await your arrival..." This should be the place Capollo mentioned in his invitation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Invitation Letter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "With this invitation, I wish to personally thank you for all you have done for the Montelli family and to amend the slight misstep in your reception. I hope this gesture will help to mend any misunderstandings and strengthen our alliance."

Dialogues.Speaker: Invitation Letter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "In the name of the Montellis, I shall honor my allies as I do my own kin and blood."

Dialogues.Speaker: Invitation Letter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "In the freest place of Ragunna, I await your arrival... Yours sincerely, Capollo Montelli."

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I knew it, another invitation. That's kind of their signature, huh? But this wasn't Carlotta, who's this Capollo guy?

Options.PlotLineKey: He's the uncle Carlotta told us about.
He's the owner of that pendant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, yeah. The big boss of the vault and all that jazz? Guess it won't hurt swinging by Carlotta's family. They do owe us a big one!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I remember now, didn't he get nabbed by the Order?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then he's got a lot to thank you for. When that sneaky Priest tried to use him as a pawn, things could've gotten messy without you and Carlotta's quick thinking.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I bet he's got something good planned. A pile of money? Maybe a mega feast?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh... hic! I've been feeling pretty weird lately, my head's all wobbly. I might not be able to show right when you need me!

Options.PlotLineKey: Just get some rest, I can manage.
I'll make sure to eat all the food for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, you've got this. If anything happens, just smash your way through!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, alright! No need to rub it in!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, I'll leave this to you then. But hey, if you ever need my help, just give me a shout, okay?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hm, to locate me so precisely and deliver the invitation right into my hands... this Capollo Montelli knows what he's doing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
At midnight, you arrive at Liberty Square, responding to an invitation from Carlotta's uncle, Capollo.
Though the invitation seems genuine, you remain wary of his true intentions. You and Abby suspect he has ulterior motives beyond mere gratitude.
Forgive me for not meeting you properly until now.
Guest from the Black Shores, Laureate of the Carnevale, savior and friend of the Montellis... {PlayerName}, your presence is an honor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Allow me to formally introduce myself. I am Capollo Montelli, Carlotta's uncle, son of the Padrino, and the next head of the family.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Given Capollo's stature, a private meeting at this hour... is it really just about gratitude?)

Options.PlotLineKey: Why the sudden invite from someone of your rank?
I hope this meeting is as simple as it seems.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course, just as stated in the invitation. I'm a man of my word.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Without you, the traitors wouldn't have been captured, and I freed from their hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While Carlotta has expressed our family's gratitude, I feel obliged to do it in person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But unfortunately, the traitors had little to offer, and the one behind them is still in the shadows. Unnerving, isn't it?

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, Carlotta is on it.
I heard it's someone high up in the family.
Sorry, your family issues aren't my concern.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll wait for her findings then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... that does narrow down the possibilities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Be as involved as you like, {PlayerName}. I won't think any less of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Things aren't as bright for the Montellis as they may seem. The Order, Fisalias, and the Fractsidus... Any attempt to break the status quo puts us at risk.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The traitors we captured were a warning, but also a reminder—to survive, I must seek alliances beyond the family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Especially with you, just as Carlotta did.

Options.PlotLineKey: You or Carlotta, what's the difference?
Thought I was already an ally to the entire family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that you mention it, let me be clear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carlotta is dear to me, and nothing will change that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But she's from the lesser branch of the family. Tradition says I, the rightful heir, should manage dealings with the Black Shores, not her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Restoring order and benefiting the family as I intended... that's what I meant in the letter by amending a slight misstep.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The leader of the Black Shores must have sent you here with a purpose. Tell me, and I will offer you support far beyond what Carlotta could provide.

Options.PlotLineKey: I can't give you an answer now.
Support with a high price, I suppose.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The choice is yours, of course... But as the family heir, I will not see my authority undermined, even by those I consider allies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So if you can't stand by my side, I'd prefer you stay out of the Montellis' affairs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Otherwise... believe me, you won't want to find yourself at odds with us, no matter how strong you are.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're welcome to remain an observer from the sidelines. But once you join the table, you play by the rules—my rules.
Well said. But the rules are not set in stone, are they?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What matter of intrigue brought you and {PlayerName} together at this hour, Uncle? A table... are we speaking of a splendid card game, then?

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your timing is most unfortunate. Our little chat just finished.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pity. I didn't think you'd pull {Male=him;Female=her} aside for a private word, especially after all Rover and I have been through together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But since you've finished, would you excuse us now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carlotta, you stay. I have more to discuss with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meet me at the rendezvous. Beware the "eyes."

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A gun is a powerful tool, but only in the hands of the worthy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand, Uncle. I've never forgotten where my privileges come from, nor will I covet what's not mine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores, the Carnevale... my sole principle is whether they benefit the Montellis.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will execute any command that strengthens the family, and crush any threats to our standing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Very well. Keep your words in mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uncle, about Benett... have you heard?

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That family thief stealing from the vault? Why, are you suggesting I failed my duties?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not at all, I just happened to overhear someone talking about it in passing...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Standing before you is Capollo, Carlotta's uncle, son of the Padrino, and the next head of the Montelli family.
While expressing gratitude for your cooperation, he warns that your deep involvement may destabilize the family's delicate balance and disrupt future plans. Capollo offers to take Carlotta's place as the family's representative in your alliance but makes it clear that, if you decline, you should avoid meddling further in Montelli affairs.
As the tension escalates, Carlotta intervenes, leaving you a cryptic message, "Meet me at the rendezvous. Beware the eyes."
Seeing you off, she brings up the recent betrayal involving Benett, the family's vault manager, who was caught stealing from the vault.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I'm more entangled in the Montelli family's schemes than I ever realized. When I went after the traitors... No, when I decided to help with the Carnevale, the game was already in play.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Carlotta warned me about eyes... So she probably wants me to avoid unnecessary attention.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Not sure why, but staying under the radar is never a bad idea.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Carlotta's not here yet. Guess I'll have to wait.)

Options.PlotLineKey: (Whoever was following me seems to have left.)
(Is he one of them?)
(There's something distinctive about his attire and demeanor...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Gentleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Might I trouble you for a light, young {Male=man;Female=lady}?

Options.PlotLineKey: Sorry, I don't have one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Gentleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah well, a cigar without smoke... My granddaughter told me Ragunna's rain is a bad omen. Can't argue with that now, can I?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Is he here by accident or design?)
(I can sound him out a bit.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've been looking at this painting for a while. Anything special about it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Gentleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, did it capture your interest as well? Or are you simply passing the time until the rain ends?

Options.PlotLineKey: Just happened to see you studying the painting.
You could say I'm waiting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Gentleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, it's only the investor's nature in me. I find myself irresistibly drawn to items of unique value.

Options.PlotLineKey: (So he's an art investor...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Gentleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then it seems you will have to put up with me for a while.

Options.PlotLineKey: (So he's waiting out the rain...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Gentleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Montelli family prides themselves on their eclectic taste in art. Any style by any artist can find its home within their quarter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Gentleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Art knows no boundaries of time, place, or the mind. Here we stand, united by the rain, drawn to the same painting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Gentleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They say in art, we glimpse pieces of our own soul.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Gentleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you make of this piece? Care to share your thoughts?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You step closer to study the collage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Small, irregular shapes nest within larger circles, their edges melding together to form a delicate harmony.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This balance, however, feels precarious, as if two opposing forces are on the verge of collision.

Options.PlotLineKey: The large circle completes itself by absorbing the small pieces.
It's too abstract for me.
Maybe the artist is seeking some kind of change.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Gentleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have keener eyes than I expected. Seeing essence beneath the surface.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Gentleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahaha, it is typical of symbolism to conceal ideas in a play of colors and forms... But sometimes, simplicity is more powerful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Gentleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed. True artistry lies not only in what is painted, but in what is left unsaid.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Gentleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I share the same view, except that I'm somehow saddened by the part that forsakes its character to achieve balance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Gentleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Perhaps chosen by the artist for its uniqueness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Gentleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now is not the time to cling to the existing balance, but to embrace the unknown, seek change, and carve out one's path... just as she once did.

Options.PlotLineKey: Seek change? You mean this painting?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You arrive at the rendezvous before Carlotta and notice Montelli members, dressed in the family's attire, quietly departing one by one. Left behind is an elderly man who is appreciating a painting.
When you approach, he reveals himself as an art-loving investor, simply waiting for the rain to stop.
He explains that now is not the time to cling to the existing balance, but to embrace the unknown and seek change... You feel there is a deeper meaning behind his thoughts on the painting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the rain finally ceases, the elderly man who had been admiring the painting quietly departs, leaving you alone to contemplate the painting's deeper meaning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Glory in Decay," the impressionist Pasoli's latest piece... Didn't know you had such refined taste.

Options.PlotLineKey: I was discussing it with an old gentleman.
He left soon after the rain stopped.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I dodged those pesky "eyes" the whole way here, worried you'd been kept waiting too long. But it seems you've kept yourself entertained.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So the old gentleman was simply hiding from the rain, was he? I see... The Montelli Quarter does attract art enthusiasts. Anyway, I'm glad prying eyes didn't follow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When it rains in Ragunna, surprises are as common as puddles. A delay is only a small splash.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Calling you here with little explanation and a word of caution... I can only imagine your confusion.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's taken me by surprise.
You and your uncle both...
The Montellis enjoy their intrigue, don't they?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Montelli's path is not always paved with roses, but with thorns as well. As the heir apparent, my uncle bears many burdens.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seeing me work with you on the Carnevale under Grandfather's orders might have unsettled him, leading to a hasty, misguided move.

Options.PlotLineKey: How do you feel about this?
Will this change your plans?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In truth, I haven't thought about it, and my opinions hold little weight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The current plan has proven effective. I believe it's wise to trust Grandfather's judgment, as I always do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, I now have more important duties to fulfill.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The shark in our midst has finally made its move.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Recently, several of our partners claimed to have found a superior seller and ended their dealings with us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meanwhile, Benett, our vault keeper, was reported to have embezzled and sold vault assets. It's said that he tried to flee but was killed by Tacet Discords outside the city.

Options.PlotLineKey: So Benett betrayed the family as well?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am not so sure... I've worked with Benett before. He was principled, bold but not reckless, not one to easily betray. And...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The night he died, he sent a photo to my Terminal—a blood-stained page of an anthology, marked with three phrases. "Thy eyes guide my course in the tempest," "When forty winters siege thy beauty," and "The planet turns right, twice and a half."

Options.PlotLineKey: That's rather cryptic.
Okay, but... it makes no sense.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The meaning is yet to be revealed, but he is clearly conveying a message.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All evidence points to Benett being the key to uncovering the shark lurking in our waters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Montelli family is a symbol of liberation for Ragunna. We uphold freedom and equality for all. Our vault is the heart of our family, and if it's corrupted, it threatens not only us, but risks plunging the city back into oppression and isolation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As much as I hate to suspect family members, I cannot rule any of them out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You, however, are different. As an outsider who has aided us in capturing the initial traitors... I hope to not be proven wrong, but I feel that I can trust you.

Options.PlotLineKey: So you're asking for my help.
I suppose this is when I volunteer to help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My uncle's words were clear. Only those at the table can play the game. To engage with my family, one must have both standing and purpose.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, I offer you a new identity in our upcoming inquiry—Cat's Eye, a provisional member under my patronage.

Options.PlotLineKey: But I'm not truly a member of the family.
This... is obviously a lie.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you wish to join, you must undertake the final assessment and pledge your loyalty to the Montellis.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, don't worry, we aren't harming anyone. It is but a subtle adaptation of the rules.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why Cat's Eye though?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When it comes to family matters, we like to use codenames, each tied to a unique token. Mine, for example, is Opal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Opal recommended Cat's Eye. It has a ring to it, don't you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Also, have you looked closely at your own eyes? They share the same luster as Cat's Eye gems.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, Cat's Eye, will you stand with me to catch the traitor within our family and avert this looming threat?

Options.PlotLineKey: Well, you recommended me, so it's your call.
We must prevent this threat and bring peace to Ragunna.
I want to uncover the true identity of this lurking shark.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand decorum is important to the Montellis. But among friends, can't we be a bit more... informal?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What made you say that?

Options.PlotLineKey: You're always one step ahead. How about we slow down and savor the present?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, you're curious who I am beyond my role, is that it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, I just might entertain that thought.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But for now, my agents just sent me the address of Benett's residence. While his body has been found, what he left behind is still out there.

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's try our luck at his residence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
When the rain stops, the elderly man quietly leaves the scene. Freed from the watchful eyes, Carlotta successfully meets with you.
She apologizes for Capollo's rudeness and confesses that she has no interest in becoming the family head. Her true concern lies with the traitors lurking within the family. She reveals that Benett, the trusted vault manager, was caught embezzling and subsequently killed by Tacet Discords outside the city. However, on the night of his death, Carlotta received a cryptic message from him.
Once again, Carlotta asks for your help to uncover the truth as you are an outsider that once aided her in capturing the initial traitors. To avoid alarming your targets, she offers you a new identity: Cat's Eye, a provisional member under her patronage.
Believing that Benett's death holds key to unraveling the truth, you decide to investigate his residence.

Chapters.Title: Go to Benett's residence in the Montelli Quarter

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems someone has acted faster. Those two... They're my uncle's agents, Sage and Acorn.

Options.PlotLineKey: Codenames?
Those are not real names.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, we address each other by codenames—handy identifiers in a crowd.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll keep you updated on the family members' codenames we encounter, along with any other details you might need.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems like they are looking for something as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's only natural my uncle wishes to retrieve the lost items... but my presence might raise a few eyebrows.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll go have a little chat with them to see what they know.
You can find a way around them and continue the investigation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, you try and loosen their lips. If memory serves, they are senior members, having served under my uncle for years. Regulars at Margherita's.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Talk business with merchants, and wine with drinkers... Engage their interests, and their words will flow like a river. As for the rest...

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll improvise as needed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Outside Benett's residence, Capollo's subordinates, Sage and Acorn, are searching for the stolen items on his order, as Capollo is in charge of the vault.
After some discussion, you and Carlotta decide to split up: she sneaks in through the back, while you confront them for information.

Options.PlotLineKey: Acorn, Sage...

Dialogues.Speaker: Acorn
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, that's you they're calling.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, that's both of us. But I don't recognize this person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Acorn
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Neither do I. Listen up.

Options.PlotLineKey: Acorn, Sage...

Dialogues.Speaker: Sage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, you got the names right. Must be family. Who are you?

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm Cat's Eye, new to the family.
I'm a Montelli.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cat's Eye? Doesn't ring a bell... Probably one of those new recruits after the Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, we are all Montellis here. Remember, when someone asks, use your codename.

Options.PlotLineKey: Oh, it's Cat's Eye.

Dialogues.Speaker: Acorn
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A rookie, huh? Learning the ropes with contacts and all. No wonder you look unfamiliar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Acorn
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, what do you need? We are just about to wrap up and grab a bite at Margherita's. Still got a lot on our plate today.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Strike up a conversation about being a newcomer.)
(Strike up a conversation about Margherita's.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Say, I've heard whispers of your skills. Seeing you here, it's clear you're on an important mission, aren't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I haven't faced a true challenge since I got here. Would you accept my help? I'm sure I'd learn a thing or two.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Easy, haha. We've just finished up. So, nothing more to help with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But here's something I can tell you. Someone tried to steal from the vault recently.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, Margherita's! Nothing quite like it, hm? And the pizza... Oh, it's a favorite in my circle, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Acorn
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah! Always a solid choice when on the move. Perfect spot for a bit of catching up.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know, the last time I was there, I heard talk about a thief stealing from the vault. Is that true?

Dialogues.Speaker: Acorn
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, cat's out of the bag now. See that house right there? That's where the thief lived. We came to search for clues.

Options.PlotLineKey: Did you recover the stolen goods?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, not yet. We've looked everywhere but found nothing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Acorn
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To be honest, I doubt we'll ever find them. The thief has probably sold everything off by now, and we are short on manpower. That's a needle in a haystack if you ask me.

Options.PlotLineKey: Isn't your boss worried?
Boss doesn't seem too worried... is there a plan B?

Dialogues.Speaker: Acorn
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, our boss is the Padrino's son. He has his methods.

Dialogues.Speaker: Acorn
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our job is to follow orders, not to ask questions. Just do what we're told and do it well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right. If you spot anything unusual, keep an eye on it. Could be your big break. With a bit more time, I think you'll do just fine.

Options.PlotLineKey: (That should do it.)
(Time to meet up with Carlotta.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You successfully gather information from Sage and Acorn, learning they found nothing in Benett's residence. They express little hope of retrieving the stolen items as Capollo didn't allocate enough resources for investigation and they also believe that Benett had already sold the items off for quite some time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You rendezvous with Carlotta after her investigation and share the information you gathered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, they found nothing, but assumed Uncle wasn't concerned?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That makes no sense. Everything that happened recently ties back to the vault. If Uncle wished to protect his position, he'd be quick to retrieve the items and resolve the situation.

Options.PlotLineKey: Maybe he's hiding something.
Maybe he's in control all along.
Things don't add up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Curiously, Benett was last sighted in the vicinity of Liberty Square, where you met Uncle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Last night, I was investigating the area before I happened upon your private meeting.

Options.PlotLineKey: That explains why you were there...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But when I brought this up to him afterward, he didn't seem privy to any details.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for my search of Benett's home, nothing of note turned up, just as the two agents reported.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I found no spoils, not even the faintest trace of them being stored or moved... Everything about his living space fits the profile of a typical junior vault employee.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've also asked around about Bennet after our previous collaboration. He was ambitious, but never greedy. I was even told he refused the bribe offered by a business associate during an operation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Montelli family is ever generous with wealth and opportunities, welcoming all who aspire to make their mark in Ragunna. Mere profit would never make him betray us.

Options.PlotLineKey: The family protects its members.
Members bring the family glory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For now, more evidence is required. The entire matter might need to be approached from a different angle...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shh, hold still... See that man over there, the one that looks like a gray dove?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Without making a movement, you follow Carlotta's line of sight. Not far away, a man, partially hidden, is frequently glancing in your direction. He seems to be observing you and Carlotta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Noticing your gaze, he immediately starts running.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After him, quick.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Sharing this information with Carlotta, you both notice some suspicious aspects: when Carlotta brought up Benett's betrayal, Capollo had remained calm, but the series of recent family troubles seem to be all linked to the vault he directly manages. If he is eager to secure his position as the next family head, he should have put more efforts in resolving these incidents. Besides, Benett was not a man who would be easily swayed by greed...
While discussing these points, you notice an elderly man observing you from a distance. Realizing he is exposed, he immediately flees, and you pursue him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nowhere to run. Now it's time for a proper chat.
Hah... These old, creaky bones of mine.
Did I offend you? Or are you just chasing down every passing soul... Never thought the Montellis would grow so aggressive.

Options.PlotLineKey: No running, no chasing.
Just a glance and you can tell we're Montellis?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He had no choice but to run, to escape his past and sever any ties with the Montellis.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No one knows the family's ways better than its members, even though... he is no longer one of us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right, Old Duncan?

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, hahaha... I must admit, you have an annoyingly good memory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's remarkable that someone of your rank would remember a man such as myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will never forget that stormy night, nor any of the members who were caught in it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sadly, I've no desire to be remembered. To me, Montelli is only a name of the past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There were moments of joy, but they cannot make up for my loss... now I only feel tired.

Options.PlotLineKey: If that's true, why are you here?
You say one thing, but do another.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why go back to what you claim to have left in the past? Unless there's something you can't ignore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You were standing across from Benett's doorway, and your clothes are still damp from the rain... You weren't simply passing by, you were watching. What were you looking for? Or should I ask, what did you hope to find?

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To grieve for my last friend in the family? To blame him for being so reckless and greedy?

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or to figure out how this fool ended up in such a mess, hoping to find the lost items and settling his debts, so he may rest in peace?

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I tried to persuade him to leave with me, but failed. In Ragunna's game, the Montelli family has only two options.

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We either play to win, or are forced to leave with nothing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every Montelli has a chance at their desires, but what's the price... They stake everything they hold dear—family, love, faith, principles, and even their life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now... his ambition and greed have cost him everything.

Options.PlotLineKey: But you can decide when to leave the table.
Is that why you left the family?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most people find acceptance easier than change, as change demands the bravery to face uncertainty. No great endeavor is without its perils.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So yes, if the Montellis are to drive the change and push past current barriers, the path ahead will be anything but easy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The family exists to withstand what an individual cannot, and accomplish what might otherwise be unattainable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But within the family, each Montelli still enjoys the freedom of choice. Your leaving is a testiment to this, is it not?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're willing, there is still much to be done for Benett. His Terminal, the alleged stolen goods... everything but his body remains missing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Given your familiarity, you might help us in locating these items...

Options.PlotLineKey: Benett's death may not be as simple as it looks.
We were also looking for more clues in his home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...In that case, you might want to speak to Scarlet Velvet.

Options.PlotLineKey: Who is this Scarlet Velvet?

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The leader of a network of commoners seeking freedom in Ragunna City. They had close ties with Benett. If he was really stealing, I'd wager they were complicit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That said, with their recent fallout with the family, I can't guarantee you'll find them, let alone talk to them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have little choice but to try.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now... let's go, {PlayerName}. We're off to the most reliable source of information in Ragunna.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Carlotta identifies the man as Duncan, a former member of the family who had long left. Duncan attributes Benett's death to insatiable lust and ambition. He shares that like Carlotta, he experienced that "stormy night" and believes all those who inherit the Montelli name are doomed to lose everything.
Carlotta respects Duncan's views, but she also sees through his inner conflict—though he wishes to sever ties with the Montelli family, he returned to Ragunna after hearing Benett's death.
You confide in Duncan about your doubts regarding Benett's death and ask him to join your investigation as his friend. After some hesitation, Duncan agrees and provides you information about Scarlet Velvet and her possible connection to Benett as the recipient of the stolen items.

Chapters.Title: Head to the "most reliable source of information"

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the place.

Options.PlotLineKey: The best place for information... is a pub?
I don't think Scarlet Velvet would hide somewhere so public.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She may not be here, but I have my ways of reaching her people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In Ragunna's market, they say fortune seldom favors those who lack a taste for fine drinks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Among traders, there's a secret "code" in the way drinks are mixed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A base of bitter almond and mint, for instance, usually signals danger and death. But some have devised their own, more private codes.

Options.PlotLineKey: So they send messages by what they order.
So it's not just a drink, it's a conversation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. This area is essentially a neutral zone in the city. No affiliations, no restrictions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the ongoing feud between Scarlet Velvet and the Montellis, finding her will be difficult. But I've heard they have eyes and ears here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So all that remains is to order the right drink, watch the crowd, and let their reactions lead us to Scarlet Velvet's contact.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bartender
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greetings, what will it be today?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Scarlet Velvet Ribbon, please.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bartender
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Scarlet Velvet... An uncommon choice. Perhaps the one you seek is waiting just as patiently. May you both find what you've come for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Carlotta explains that Scarlet Velvet and her group not only may be in contact with Benett but had recently severed ties with Montalli, ceasing all transactions with the family.
Growing more suspicious, you decide to contact Scarlet Velvet. Following Ragunna's code, you and Carlotta use alcohol as a signal to find her contact.

Dialogues.Speaker: Joyous Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The wild desires, they swallow me like the roaring waves. Oh, how maddening is your tender love! I'd forsake all, just to be forever lost in your embrace...

Options.PlotLineKey: Hello.

Dialogues.Speaker: Joyous Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But is this amber drink... a deadly poison, or a healing tonic?

Options.PlotLineKey: Excuse me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Joyous Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, leave me be! Don't bother me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Joyous Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The void... the endless void has consumed me. I want no part in anything... Who are you, and who am I?

Dialogues.Speaker: Joyous Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Montelli, Fisalia, the Order, the commoners—without these names, what sets us apart? But reality is cruel, and we have no refuge!

Options.PlotLineKey: Seems like the alcohol has brought out his inner bard.
Is he just drunk or completely out of it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For a moment, you sense a pair of eyes on you from where you picked up your drink. But as you turn to look, the feeling quickly fades away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go. Clearly he's not the one we are looking for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Voluble Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, there you are. I noticed you as soon as you walked in.

Options.PlotLineKey: Care to join me for a drink?
So, will you take this drink?

Dialogues.Speaker: Voluble Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't get me wrong. I've only been here long enough to recognize that drink, but I'm not making any guarantees beyond that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Voluble Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, that swagger and flair... You're with the Montelli family, am I right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Voluble Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know I'm not the one you came for, but don't dash off just yet. You don't know what I have up my sleeve, you know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Voluble Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about you let me prove how reliable I can be for your family? Go on, test me.

Options.PlotLineKey: Ask about Benett.
Ask about Scarlet Velvet.
Ask about Carlotta.
Tell me the most curious thing you've heard.

Dialogues.Speaker: Voluble Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, if you're talking about Benett Montelli, he's right at the heart of the family's latest drama. Word is, he has broken the family's oath.

Dialogues.Speaker: Voluble Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But one of his greatest moments was recovering a lost shipment with the family's young lady. Isn't life full of ironies?

Dialogues.Speaker: Voluble Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She may not carry the Montelli name, but she's got that same pioneering spirit. She's leading a team of Resonators now, hunting down Tacet Discords in the wild.

Dialogues.Speaker: Voluble Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a shame though, she recently decided to cut ties with the Montellis. And here I thought they were kindred spirits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Voluble Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, that name? She's the second Montelli daughter, but she usually goes by another codename—Opal—when on duty.

Dialogues.Speaker: Voluble Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Er, but you'd better ask the lady next to you yourself. In our line of work, it's considered rude to discuss someone when they're within earshot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Voluble Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard some rumors that the Montellis and the Order might have closer relationship than they're letting on... But I wouldn't bet on it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Voluble Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When change is coming, you can always sense it in the air. It's hard to pin down at first, but when you do, it's often too late.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For an instant, you feel a gaze from where you got your drink, but it vanishes as soon as you turn to look.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Impressive. You've proved yourself capable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Three days from now, at this hour, return here and order a "Golden Ears Mambo." Watch for someone wearing a green tourmaline.

Dialogues.Speaker: Obsessed Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Kirsch, whiskey... and cherry tomatoes? Does it mean revenge?

Dialogues.Speaker: Obsessed Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, blood orange, gin... that drink you have there is quite rare. Would you mind telling me what it means?

Options.PlotLineKey: You will know it when you need to.
It's a secret too terrifying to speak of...

Dialogues.Speaker: Obsessed Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, a riddle cloaked in mystery! You don't want to share, hm? Ha... Sorry... I am simply enthralled by symbols and codes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Obsessed Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, wait! Maybe I'm not ready for this. Ah, forget it. I don't want to know!

Dialogues.Speaker: Obsessed Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Imperator above! I am but a humble man obsessed with the secret "code" of drinks! I shan't risk my neck over this...

Options.PlotLineKey: What grand schemes occupy your time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Obsessed Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh, I-I've been exploring how drinks might encode numerical values, through alcohol content or vintage, perhaps. But lately I'm starting to wonder if the drink itself even matters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The key to any language lies in the shared rules and agreements between both parties.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With that in mind, the same drink, or even the same object, can be given countless meanings… much like how my people and I sometimes improvise codes with whatever's available.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For an instant, you feel a gaze from where you got your drink, but it vanishes as soon as you turn to look.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sounds like you've been at this "code" research for quite some time. Mind if I ask you a question?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you know when the bartender started his shift today?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Is Carlotta suspecting the bartender?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Obsessed Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me see... I got here quite early, and he was here about the same time. Probably around eight o'clock in the morning?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. That's all I needed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bartender
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anything else I can get you? Or is there a problem with the drinks?

Options.PlotLineKey: No, it's you we have a problem with.
No, we are here for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As expected from a Scarlet Velvet informant, you are smart. In a place like this, a bartender is the perfect cover, the least noticeable but with the best view.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mix every drink and pass every "code." You might not understand all of them, but nothing of importance ever escapes you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, this Scarlet Velvet Ribbon... is meant for you. Am I correct, sir?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bartender
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, well... it finds its way back to me at last. A drink of trouble, I'd call it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bartender
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Contact has been made, and by the rules, a conversation should follow. But Scarlet Velvet has decided there will be no further dealings with the Montellis.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bartender
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The partnership is broken, and whatever bond you had is all but gone. If you do meet up, Lady Carlotta, aren't you afraid things might turn ugly?

Options.PlotLineKey: There's no need to fight when we can talk.
We're here to solve problems.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's rumored that Scarlet Velvet's decision to end our partnership has something to do with a vault keeper named Benett.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bartender
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Surely you don't believe that nonsense?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then what is the truth? Benett was recently found dead in the wild... The dead are silent, but you are not. So let's talk.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bartender
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, Benett is dead?

Options.PlotLineKey: So there was a connection after all.
Seems like the news hasn't reached you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bartender
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That complicates things, I'm afraid.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bartender
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not sure if trusting Montelli is a wise choice, but in memory of Benett... If you truly are as noble as he believed...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bartender
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go to Whisperwind Haven after dusk. I will inform Scarlet Velvet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and Carlotta quickly deduce that the bartender is the contact for Scarlet Velvet. Though he may not understand all of the cryptic messages, nothing of importance escapes him. While the bartender is not optimistic about your meeting with Scarlet Velvet, he doesn't stop you as you followed the rules and found him. It also seems that he has heard of Carlotta's character from Benett. Therefore, he promises to arrange a meeting for you with Scarlet Velvet at Whisperwind Haven at dask.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cold Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Terminals are divine artifacts from the Sentinel, brought to Rinascita by the first Primus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cold Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What you possessed were nothing but privately made replicas, existing solely by the grace of the Primus. How dare you defy our cleansing of such blasphemy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We never stopped asking the Order for permission to wear the Terminals, but every single request is denied. You won't even tell us why!

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've controlled the Terminal supply, and the family stopped trading with us... These are all we have left. Why should we hand them over?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cold Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can sense your fervent desire for the artifacts and the blessings from the Sentinel... But whether you are worthy of the terminals is for the Order to decide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cold Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you willingly part with your wealth in devotion to the Order's divine cause, the door to forgiveness might still be open.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cold Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But should you persist in your defiance... we'll have to escort you to the Penitentiary for judgment.

Options.PlotLineKey: People are quarreling there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order and the commoners... it must be Scarlet Velvet causing the stir.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order's arrogance is known, but such blatant actions... Is it because we're far from the heart of the city?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's first address their troubles, and then we'll have a proper talk.

Chapters.Title: Help Scarlet Velvet address their troubles
Help Scarlet Velvet address their troubles

Dialogues.Speaker: Cold Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, the Montelli's second daughter and this year's Laureate. I suggest you tread carefully and avoid crossing the Order and the Sentinel, especially not for the sake of mere commoners.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cold Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Must I remind you again? Trading Reserved Terminals is a breach of the discipline.

Options.PlotLineKey: I didn't see anyone trading Terminals here.
All I see is you taking what's rightfully theirs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We paid good money for these. If you're taking them, you owe us a refund.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cold Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet the very traders who took your money have seen the error of their ways and reported your dealings. They have sworn to repent for their illicit production and cease all trade with you.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Illicit production, traders... Is he talking about the Montellis?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Cold Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How sad, Ms. Carlotta. Such loyalty to your family, only to be left in the dark. No one bothered to inform you, did they?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, please. My ties with the family are not so fragile as to be shaken by mere words.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The fact that we are having this conversation at all means that you cannot ignore my status, wouldn't you agree?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel and the Primus have declared free trade as our undeniable right. Scarlet Velvet is always entitled to trade as they please, regardless of their previous partnerships.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You preach the doctrine, yet fail to adhere to it yourself. If I were you, I'd be on my way to the Penitentiary. Willful transgression... is the worst blasphemy one can imagine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cold Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mark my words! The day Montelli is brought to its knees by the Order and Fisalia will be the day you beg for the Sentinel's mercy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cold Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When that day comes, all shall be under the Order's control. And it will not be long in coming.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Acolyte departs with his entourage. Scarlet Velvet signals the others to leave and assess the damages.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ernesto, the bartender, said you needed to see me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You may have just defended us, but you heard it—your family has left us in a mess. Frankly, I don't see the point in having this conversation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But since Ernesto said it's about Benett, I'll give you a minute, for his sake. Speak quickly.

Options.PlotLineKey: What you heard could be another lie from the Order.
What if the Order is trying to turn us against each other?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Regardless of the bigger picture, your side ended the deal. We were informed on short notice to stop all trade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And it's not just the Terminals—no more "jewelry," "perfumes," and all that nonsense. You saw what happened today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not to mention I haven't seen a Montelli for nearly two weeks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where were you when we were fighting against the Order and the Fisalias?

Options.PlotLineKey: Montelli has been dealing with its own troubles lately.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There was a slight issue of a traitor in the vault, so our hands were tied.

Options.PlotLineKey: You sure don't beat around the bush.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A direct approach works best at times. Actually, what that Acolyte claimed is news to me. Surrendering control and ceasing trade... are not in the Montelli's vocabulary.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Montelli creed has always been family first, and a pioneering spirit second.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With your grandfather, maybe, but he won't be around forever. When Capollo takes the helm... you won't have a say.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The real question is whether we can get our trade back on track. Can your family still be trusted? What I need is a solid promise from someone in charge—can you do that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One thing's for sure, I don't want to see the family who first broke the monopoly to trade with us commoners end up defending it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll speak with my uncle and grandfather to see what happened with our cooperation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know what? This is supposed to be your family's business. Why am I saying this to you... Excuse my earlier words.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... Ernesto told me Benett's gone. What happened? He seemed fine the last time we met.

Options.PlotLineKey: Some say he got what he deserved for stealing from the vault.
And there are rumors that you helped him fence the stolen items.
Of course, we think there's more to the story.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good judgment there! The rumors are nonsense… Fencing stolen goods? Please. Benett used to handle our shipments for the vault, but everything was above board.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing shady, okay? He knew his stuff—never took advantage of us, never budged on prices either.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For him, it was always business first, friendship second. When he was running late, he'd stay up that hill sometimes. We even set up a shelter there after it happened a few times. That's all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come to think of it, he did stay there for a while the last time we saw him. Asked us to stash something too. What was it he said… "Hope we don't need to use it."

Options.PlotLineKey: (So Benett left something behind on purpose...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems Benett may have anticipated the trouble ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wonder if you might show us to the shelter? We'd be most grateful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scarlet Velvet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's an entrance along the coast. Go straight down the road and you will see it. What's your business there, anyway?

Options.PlotLineKey: To test our hypothesis and see if there's anything of importance hidden.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Realizing that retrieving the Reserved Terminal is impossible, the Acolytes attempt to further sever the relationship between Scarlet Velvet and Montelli before departing.
According to Scarlet Velvet, it is not her group that severed ties but Montelli themselves. The family revoked their rights to purchase Reserved Terminals and weapons, as well as their protection. This revelation surprises Carlotta, as it contradicts Montelli's philosophy of proactive expansion. She asserts her stance to resume trading and assure that Montelli, which once broke the monopoly, will never become a supporter of it.
Regarding Benett, Scarlet Velvet denies the possibility of him stealing from the vault and reveals that Benett foresaw his own death, leaving something behind at the coast, hoping it would never come into handy.

Chapters.Title: Go to the entrance along the coast

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This way.

Chapters.Title: Defeat the TDs in the cave

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't let your guards down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Enemies ahead.

Chapters.Title: Defeat the TDs in the cave
Go to the shelter where Benett used to stay

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can tell someone was here, look at the mess. Perhaps Benett deliberately arranged it this way as a cover.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll each use our sensors to search, then let's gather and analyze the clues we find.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You notice a slightly faded oil painting. The woman in it wears a serene and enigmatic smile.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you look closer, you see the pencil marks of the letters "ML" and "CL" in the woman's eyes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You come across a tattered book. As you flip through it, nothing seems out of place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe this is what Benett left. You decide to take the book and inspect it later with Carlotta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You spot a small, delicate rotor device, but you have no idea how to open it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You decide to take the device and inspect it later with Carlotta.

Chapters.Title: Use Sensor to search for clues

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You share the clues and items you found with Carlotta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Something is strange here.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These items aren't exactly rare, but they're not everyday objects either. They seem out of place here. Looks like Benett left them deliberately.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed. But what I find strange is... these items, don't they seem familiar?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you recall those three lines from the anthology? The ones Benett sent to me in the photo?

Options.PlotLineKey: There seems to be a connection here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Thy eyes guide my course in the tempest," the woman in the painting here seems to stand in the gloomy rain, but her eyes remain bright.

Options.PlotLineKey: This line refers to the letters ML and CL in the eyes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like the secret "code" in drinks, what matters is never the objects themselves, but the shared rules and agreements between both parties.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, the book. It appears to be about winter, which is likely related to the second line, forty winters...

Options.PlotLineKey: Forty winters... try page 40.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You flip the book to page forty, and there, written in large numbers, are 1, 9, and 0.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The last one is a rotor device, the planet...

Options.PlotLineKey: Revolves right twice and a half.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and Carlotta rotate the device two and a half times to the right. With a click, a slip of paper pops out, showing numbers 4, 6, and 8.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: MLCL190468? That format—It's a vault storage code.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course it is. Benett was a vault keeper. But what was he trying to convey in such a cryptic manner?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Four letters... the highest clearance level in the vault. Could it be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hold on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carlotta? Uh... you asked me to keep an eye out for Benett's Terminal. Well, I've found it.

Options.PlotLineKey: Amazing. Where did you find it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's for me to know and you to wonder.

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... it was not in good shape after what it went through. If you can use it at all, the data and records inside might need to be recovered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understood. I'll have someone pick it up for restoration.

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, wait... n-now? You're not even... gonna check?

Options.PlotLineKey: Why are you stuttering?
Isn't it a good thing that we've found the Terminal?

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, it's nothing, really. Just worried it might be too tricky to repair.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, we'll inform you when there's more to share.

Options.PlotLineKey: What now, shall we go get that Terminal?
Or see what item the code represents?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're returning to the Montelli Quarter first. The Terminal will be fixed there. As for the codes, we'll figure it out once we arrive...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, you might not know this, but Benett was never granted the highest clearance in the vault.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Isn't that a good sign? It means Benett might not be guilty after all, just as you suspected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it's replaced by another suspicion, one I am reluctant to entertain but am... forced to consider.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only Grandfather, Uncle, and I have the highest clearance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Liberty Square, our proximity, the vault's security clearance, a traitor among the top brass... the indifference toward the stolen goods, and the authority to end dealings with Scarlet Velvet...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's someone all evidence points to... Were I to entertain it... it all starts to makes sense. Uncle...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if it was truly him—the heir to our family—who betrayed us, wouldn't that be utterly absurd?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, all that remains is to see what the code reveals. It might clear our doubts... or confirm it.

Options.PlotLineKey: There's only one way to find out.
Whether it will clear our doubts or confirm it...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll be with you no matter what. So let's see where this leads.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Deciphering the wine code, you and Carlotta piece together the cryptic message Benett sent on the night of his death. The message points to a collection requiring the highest level of authority in the vault. At the same time, you also receive good news from Duncan—he successfully retrieved Benett's Terminal, though it is severely damaged and requires repair.
A chilling possibility begins to form in Carlotta's mind: all the suspicious details seem to be pointing to Capollo. To uncover the true traitor, you need to return to Montelli headquarters, repair the terminal, and locate the collection indicated by Benett.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My people just reported some initial progress on the Terminal repair.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go. Our meet-up spot is right up ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Agent
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Carlotta, we received a Terminal addressed to you, signed "DC."

Options.PlotLineKey: ("DC"... It's from Duncan.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Agent
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The initial restoration is almost complete, but some data is overwritten or isolated due to the extensive damage... We were only able to recover certain sections.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Agent
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our evaluation suggests that a full restoration might not be worth it. But if you insist, Mr. Pierre at the headquarters is an expert in this field.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good, make sure to contact him. Now, please project the restored sections.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Agent
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Absolutely, one moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carlotta's agent takes out the damaged Terminal and projects the restored data before she leaves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you and Carlotta review the projected data, you notice a pattern of movements between Margherita's, Benett's home, and the vault with only two deviations—Liberty Square and a dock.

Options.PlotLineKey: Liberty Square... I was there not long ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, that's where I was investigating that night. Seems like the intel was right—Benett did go there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the other location... I think it's my uncle's private dock, primarily used for storage, not shipments.

Options.PlotLineKey: Capollo again? That does sound fishy.
Should we head over after this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, reviewing the records hardly proves the connections between these locations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If time permits, we should take the Terminal to Mr. Pierre. He is an old friend of Grandfather's, and is an expert in this field.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There may be other useful information in the Terminal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But first, let's put that code to use. It could help us narrow down the range and provide better clues.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Follow me. This is why I suggested we return here. Our vault holds everything—family property, valuable items for trade, and prized possessions entrusted to us by clients...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...The complete inventory and access records can only be found here, accessible to those with the proper clearance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Benett's Terminal is severely damaged, so only basic data are restored. The recovered data shows  Benett's movements, and you notice two suspicious coordinates: one points to the Liberty Square that Carlotta previously investigated, and the other is Capollo's private dock.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please follow me.

Chapters.Title: Access the records for the code

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What seemed to be an unremarkable ornament blending into the Quarter turns out to play a crucial role. After navigating multiple codes and biometric authentications, a holographic screen finally appears before you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone extracted the core data module... It's empty now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This must be what Benett was trying to tell us before he died. Someone with access to the vault has broken their oath and leaked the data module. Now, only Uncle, Grandfather, and I have the clearance to retrieve it.

Options.PlotLineKey: So that clears up all the questions.
I see. But what can he gain from it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In Rinascita, the Order maintains control over Terminals, unlike other countries where they are freely traded. My grandfather learned to modify them during his early ventures in the New Federation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our lantern-type Terminal is a modified model. It may look purely ornamental, but it houses the tech modules we've developed. As Scarlet Velvet said, aside from our art dealings, we've been supplying these Terminals to Resonators at fair prices as part of our discreet business.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By doing so, we've broken the Order's monopoly. We've given more people the means to protect themselves in their ventures, giving them choices they didn't have before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order is aware of our discreet business, but they turn a blind eye as long as we don't openly challenge their authority. The hefty taxes we pay maintain this... delicate understanding.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As a result, no family member would ever divulge our Terminal secrets, much less allow the modules to fall into the wrong hands. What exactly are you planning, Uncle?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, we must find the core module...

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carlotta, where are you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uncle, may I ask you something first? Before the Carnevale, the Priest showed me your pendant. How did he come by it, and what led to your capture?

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Does it matter? All you need to know is that it's handled, and I'm in the clear now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Were you mistreated? Did they coerce you into doing something against your will?

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heed my words. Whatever you've uncovered, put it behind you, and all will be as it was. No grudges, no consequences, only family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, we've had some trouble with a shipment over at Septimont. As the rightful heir, I'm giving you a new order. Take care of it, and I'll pretend none of this ever happened.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I refuse.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excuse me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I said I refuse! I can't act as if nothing happened. I won't let a family member die unjustly, or see our modules fall into the wrong hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't trouble yourself with the module. Yes, our family's ambition has led us far, but it's exacted a price paid in blood and tears. What harm is there in choosing the safer, easier path?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't believe you just said that. So, you're refusing to tell the truth and reveal the module's location, is that it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why do you insist on tearing everything apart? Have you ever thought about what Padrino would say? What others will think of us? I've given you an out, all you need to do is accept it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then so be it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your course is set. As is mine. But mark my words... I will stop you, Mr. Capollo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry you have to see this side of our family.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's okay to be a little less perfect with friends.
It's messy, but still manageable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? I just wish... No, I did promise I'd try to drop the pretense with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I may need more time to come to terms with all this. I don't regret uncovering the truth and exposing the traitor… I'm just saddened that my uncle is the one behind it all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We were meant to be the guardians of our family's ideals, to carry the torch forward. And yet, now…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, wallowing in emotion won't solve anything. Our priority now is to recover the data module. Every moment it's missing puts our family at greater risk.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The core module is difficult to carry around. They must have hidden it... The dock Benett visited, used for storage... Could it be there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to adjust our strategy. My conversation with Capollo will have alerted him. He's likely to move the module sooner than expected. I need to inspect the dock for any clues.

Options.PlotLineKey: We may restore more data in this Terminal.
There could still be other possibilities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed, but time is not on our side. If Capollo acts on this, I might lose my window to secure the module. Our sole advantage now is that we're operating as a pair.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need you to take this terminal to Pierre at the bank. If the dock turns out to be a dead end, we will need other leads.

Options.PlotLineKey: What's your next move if we find the module?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know that securing the module alone won't suffice. I must uncover Capollo's true motives...how it will affect our family. I'll figure it out, I promise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to the plan, you and Carlotta part ways. She heads alone to the dock she mentioned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The collection the message points to turns out to be the family's custom-made Reserved Terminal, and all clues suggest that Capollo was the one who removed the core data module from the Terminal, and Benett was framed for embezzlement.
During communication, Carlotta rejects Capollo's proposal to move past the matter, unable to ignore Benett's death and the hidden threats within the family.
Time is pressing, so Carlotta quickly decides to split up, with you taking Benett's Terminal to an expert named Pierre for a thorough repair, while she heads to Capollo's private dock to find out more clues or retrieve the missing core data module.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They call it a dock, but no ships ever come. Uncle has concealed what he took from the vault here—a secluded place entirely under his control.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For a secret trove of such value, the lack of security is strange. There was little resistance on my way here. This can't be right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, I sense an energy fluctuation nearby... Time to investigate. The size of this place is manageable. I should be able to trace the source quickly.

Chapters.Title: Investigate nearby to find clues about the data module

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You track the energy fluctuation, sifting through the gaps between stashed goods and looking for its source.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A storage box catches your eye. Inside, a stunning handicraft adorned with jewels sits in stillness. It's exquisite, but not what you seek.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You trace the energy fluctuation to the piled goods and start looking for its source.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On the left, a delicate aroma of wine fills the air as you spot bottles of golden osmanthus wine. To the right, carefully folded custom-made clothes catch your eye with their luxurious fabrics.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But none of them are the data module you seek, nor do they seem connected to the mysterious energy fluctuation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Nothing so far... Was I wrong? Maybe this place doesn't hold what we were looking for? Why did Benett come here, then?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Or am I too late... Did Capollo get here first?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (And the energy fluctuation... it was going off and on... No, I couldn't have been imagining it.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Such a big mirror... Why is it here?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (It doesn't seem to be made of common glass, but some kind of crystallized energy... Oh.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Will I find the data module on the other side...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Or was all this just a trap...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You arrive at the bank as Carlotta said, looking for the expert in Terminal studies named Pierre.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carlotta arrives at the dock as planned. Following a strange energy fluctuation, she finds a stained-glass mirror buried under cargo. At that moment, a hand adorned with a blue-black ornament suddenly reaches out from the mirror, pulling her inside—the coordinates are a trap in disguise.

Chapters.Title: Search near the bank for Mr. Pierre

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Gentleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello again.

Options.PlotLineKey: Hello again, Carlotta's grandfather.
You must be Francesco, the current head of the Montelli family.
Should I call you Padrino like the rest do?

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It would be my honor if you do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't seem very surprised to learn who I am.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carlotta told me Mr. Pierre always follows her grandfather around. My instincts weren't wrong when I saw you together.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It also explains why you seemed familiar when we first met.

Options.PlotLineKey: Was our previous meeting really a coincidence?

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's the term for it... A destined encounter? The universe brought us together, and I happened to take the initiative. It's almost poetic, wouldn't you agree?

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's it, I doubt you want more chit-chat. I know you're here for that Terminal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let Pierre inspect it for you and we can resume our conversation.

Options.PlotLineKey: You knew I was coming.
And you knew why I'm here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
