Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember that painting we discussed earlier?

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In a fragile equilibrium, the smaller piece is forced to repress its true nature. It's confined to a seemingly flawless structure, stripped of its autonomy. I don't want the same fate for her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I can't simply impose my path upon her, expecting blind obedience. She must find her own path, with a partner she can fully trust.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for those who betray their own blood, there will be no leniency. Even my own son is not exempt from this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, before I intervene, I want to see her plan take shape. My hand should only be played as a final measure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The old give way to the new, that is the way of the world. But for us Montellis, the courage to break from the past matters far more than clinging to it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, I ask you this favor. When the time is right, give this to her. She will need it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierre
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a little tricky... but you're lucky to have my expertise!

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierre
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Terminal is defunct, but I've retrieved all its data, even the overwritten and isolated bits.

Options.PlotLineKey: You mean, data was erased from it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierre
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Terminal has been tampered with, but nothing was intentionally erased. It seems they wanted to overwrite the data to avoid detection.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierre
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can show you. Do you have a Terminal? I'll send over the data so you can see for yourself.

Options.PlotLineKey: These records...

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I assume you've taken care of Benett's body?

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo's Agent
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We... dumped him in the Tacet Discord zone overnight. We'll claim he was killed by those monsters tomorrow morning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo's Agent
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sir... are you sure? Are we really going to work with the Order... after they made you kill one of our own?

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're in too deep now. Handing over the data module to the Order will cement out position as an ally of the authorities. We'll replace the Fisalias! The other Resonators in the city are irrelevant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And Benett... I would have taken care of him regardless.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He knew too much. He deserved it for pursuing the Scarlet Velvet matter. Anyone who gets in my way shall meet the same fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo's Agent
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Y-Yes, sir...

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We all stood together on that stormy night, each one of us losing someone dear. And we all share the desire for our family to find an easier path forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The best way to avoid sacrifice isn't fighting, but aligning ourselves with superior powers and knowing when to yield.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You may have left the family, and I should expect no more favors from you. But I ask this of you one last time. Please, put this Terminal in Carlotta's hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's in it? Carlotta.. What will happen to her?

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing, save for the standard location tracking data every Terminal holds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In three days, I'll be negotiating on behalf of the family with the Order. I just want to make sure Carlotta doesn't interfere in the meantime. She'll be given a chance to join our side, I promise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Think about Benett. If you take care of this, I will overlook what he stole and let it be a thing of the past. I know you care more about your late friend than you're willing to admit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo's Agent
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unbelievable. What is Capollo even thinking? Killing one of our own... It's a complete betrayal of our family! I must record all this madness with something...

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo's Agent
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My Terminal? No, it's too risky. Wait... I have Benett's body... Nobody's going to pay attention to a dead man's Terminal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo's Agent
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll record it, then overwrite with new data.... I have to keep this record well... In case I also...

Options.PlotLineKey: That Terminal... It was part of Capollo's schemes!
They set a trap in the docks...
Carlotta... Tsk, I can't reach her now.
I must go check on her immediately.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierre
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A trap? Wait, sir... Wouldn't Lady Carlotta be in danger? I don't think that is part of your plan. Are you really letting her face this by herself?

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's already there, so why bother? I trust Carlotta and our esteemed guest. It is a trap, but also an opportunity for her to mature.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Standing beside Pierre is the elderly man you once saw admiring the painting—Francesco, the current head of the Montelli family, also known as ""Padrino."" His words are not just about the painting but also about Carlotta. Rather than relying on his own plan, he hopes that Carlotta and her companions can offer their own solution.
Then he entrusts you with a crucial item to be given to her at the right time.
After fully restoring the Terminal, you uncover hidden data—it turns out that Capollo deliberately handed this Terminal to Duncan to lure Carlotta into the trap at the dock.
With Carlotta now missing, you must rush to the location to save her.

Chapters.Title: Search near the bank for Mr. Pierre

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the meantime, Carlotta is seeing fragments of her past in a mysterious space.

Dialogues.Speaker: Frightened Child
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-what is that...

Dialogues.Speaker: Dignified Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The family will shield you

Chapters.Title: Find a way out of the mirror realm

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These flashbacks... Could it be from touching that mirror? Energy crystals made into a mirror, with a pre-made Sonoro inside... Hmm, a sly trap.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Sonoro, the docks, Benett's Terminal, Duncan... When did it all begin?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the hand that pulled me in... I need to get to the bottom of this, and quickly.

Chapters.Title: Defeat the TDs in the court

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These masterless Echoes have turned hostile... The frequency fluctuations in this Sonoro seem unstable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll have to handle them before I can search the area.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And there's even more?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How strange. I'm being led in circles. They don't seem to want me near the mansion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now there's nothing else in my way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All these obstacles suggest the answer is likely there... I must investigate that mansion. The way out and clues I need may lie within its walls.

Chapters.Title: Find clues for the way out

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This layout and decor seem strikingly similar to our mansion, just with slight differences.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This area... These decorations, the chandelier specifically, were destroyed during the invasion five years ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Am I truly in the past or trapped in some kind of simulation?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Blue Rain"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're telling me he's adopting that orphan girl from the other side of the family, spare me. Already heard.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Blue Rain"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Actually, I imagine the whole family's caught wind of it by now. Isn't that why we're throwing this rally for her today?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Retriever"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tell me, how on earth do you stay in the loop, tinkering away at home like that? You must be shocked, Capollo is already the heir, so why on earth did he adopt her?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In a corner of the mansion, Carlotta's gaze is drawn to two members engaged in conversation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Orphan girl from the other side of the family, adopted by Padrino... This rally... held for me?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (A mere touch of the mirror was enough to instantly draw out my memories, experiences, and even passing thoughts, creating this Sonoro.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carlotta pauses, trying to make sense of the situation, but one of the members suddenly notices her and begins asking questions, much to her surprise.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Retriever"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm? You look a little fami— Oh, it's you again! What brings you back here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You shouldn't know me yet. Not at this time.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Retriever"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't understand... What time? What are you talking about?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, please don't mind what I just said. I'm not really sure where I am, why I am here, or what I need to do.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Blue Rain"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Actually, I think he meant to say we just saw you. Just now, uh, about a minute ago. You walked right past us and headed that way.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Retriever"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, I'm just surprised you're back so soon. By the way, you do look a bit different, don't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Retriever"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your outfit... No, it's more the accessories, really. Yours are red, but the person I saw had blue ones on her wrists... Hmm. Perhaps I'm imagining things.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Blue accessories... I saw blue accessories on that hand that pulled me inside.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I suppose she's the friend who invited me here. Could you tell me where she's gone? I've been left alone since arriving, and I believe I really should meet her.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Blue Rain"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps she's just out for a stroll? The preparations are behind schedule due to a mishap, and everyone's waiting for the rally to begin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Yes, now I remember... the rally didn't start on time because of a lighting malfunction....)

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (On the other hand, once the lights are turned on... Something may change, and it could reveal new clues.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. I think I know where I'm going now.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Retriever"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh, you're welcome, I suppose? Not that we've done much for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I doubt it means much to say this to you… since you only exist in this place, and unlike me, you probably don't need to hear this. But I believe Padrino took her in because he saw the makings of a true Montelli.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The world inside the mirror seems no different from reality, yet it is only a projection of memories, past, and desires. As Carlotta explores her surroundings and interacts with the family members, she realizes the hand that dragged her into this world belongs to her mirror self. To escape, she needs to find her mirror self.

Chapters.Title: Pop the balloons around the venue
Check the notes hidden inside the balloons
Enter the passcode to activate the lights (6289)
Return to a suitable location and wait for the rally to begin

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All right. Time to check the lobby.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Francesco"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come over, my child.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sir... are you talking to me?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Francesco"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Fret not, Carlotta. Come up to the front so everyone can see you.

Options.PlotLineKey: (I'm looking at what happened <color=yellow>eleven years ago</color>...)
(Two entirely different moments are crossing paths right now...)

Dialogues.Speaker: "Francesco"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Today is a special day, the beginning of your journey as one of us.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Francesco"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As my granddaughter, you will now carry the Montelli name—my name, the family's name—and with it, its privileges and responsibilities.

Dialogues.Speaker: "La Llorona"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I knew it! She shares our bloodline!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Backwindow"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She is a true Montelli, just like the Padrino!

Options.PlotLineKey: (It's like I am reliving <color=yellow>the past</color>...)
(This is <color=yellow>not exactly how it happened</color>.)

Dialogues.Speaker: "Clockwork"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Puny little thing... such a nervous look to her.

Dialogues.Speaker: "La Llorona"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Isn't she from the lesser side of the family? And a girl at that... Why her? What makes her worthy of the Montelli name?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Backwindow"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My thoughts exactly. I fail to see how she could possibly belong to our ranks, let alone carry the family name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...It was you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Recognition, praise, glory, isn't that what you want?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stay here, and you'll have all of that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that... the exit?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The scene before Carlotta mirrors memories from eleven years ago, but the events veer in an unexpected direction. The family members who once rejected her as Padrino's adopted granddaughter and opposed her taking the Montelli name now welcome her with open arms. Acknowledged, praised, and elevated—everything she ever craved is within reach if she chooses to stay.
Yet, Carlotta fires a shot at the mirror. The bullet shatters her mirror self, creating a new passage, leading to a different place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dazzling sunlight… Am I in the court? Have I left that Sonoro already?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, the question is... What moment from my past does this represent?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, these decorations...they aren't real, even if they appear to be. This is just another simulation from my memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How do I leave this place?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave? But didn't you just follow me here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Cut the nonsense. You were the one who brought me into this Sonoro.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, fine. But why should I tell you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: True, I brought you here. But remember, I am a product of your own making—your memories, your desires, your fantasies...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From this moment on, I am also Carlotta Montelli. We will share the same past, present, and perhaps even future.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't pretend we're alike in any way. And keep the Montelli name out of your filthy mouth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, right! How could I forget? You worked so hard to earn the illustrious Montelli name back then... And this was your humble abode, correct?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A poor little girl from the forgotten side of the family, trying desperately to fit in with the grandeur of her new home, fearing abandonment, and playing the part of a proper lady.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're a star in the ballroom, a top investor at the auction house. But your true talent? Being the family's favorite weapon, carrying out orders without question. Is that all you live for?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought you'd be thrilled with what I'm offering you! Acceptance, validation, indispensability... Did you see how everyone adored you? Isn't this a dream come true?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, planning to shoot me again?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't bother. This Sonoro is born from your consciousness, and it's also my domain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since the frequencies here can be shattered, they can also be brought together again… Why not try shooting yourself? Perhaps that will work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't be so quick to deny it. If you truly never craved acceptance and recognition, would I even exist?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since praise and affirmation aren't enough for you... I'll give you a chance to prove yourself. Show me how much your sweat and tears are worth!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Carlotta demands that her mirror self reveal the way out. However, this reflection, sharing the same memories, past, and desires, exposes Carlotta's complex emotions—her fear of abandonment, gratitude for her family's protection, and relentless drive to live as their blade, bringing honor to the Montelli name.
Why, then, does she reject the perfect life offered in the mirror?
Frustrated, the mirror self recreates the "stormy night," forcing Carlotta to prove her worth and make up for regrets once more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nice work, but this is only the beginning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You must be dying to know which part of the past this is. Would you like a little hint?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The wind abruptly ceases, leaving Carlotta enveloped in an oppressive, humid stillness tinged with a metallic scent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As she gazes up at the overcast sky, a haunting memory of that fateful, rain-soaked evening resurfaces, one she had desperately tried to leave behind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Blood debts will catch up with those who have to pay. The storm is coming...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, now you remember. I knew you'd never forget. The rain that night never ceased in your heart.
Help... Help...
Damn it! This is a trap! They've taken what's ours! In the name of the Montellis, this won't go... unpunished...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you hear that? Oh, the panic in their voice! How they must be begging for a capable leader to come and save the day?

Chapters.Title: Join the discussion with other family members

Dialogues.Speaker: "Capollo"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Three key areas have been hit one after another: South Second Block, West End dock, and our headquarters.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Capollo"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Intel says the Fisalias are gearing up for another hit on our headquarters. As usual, we can expect the Order to turn a blind eye.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Capollo"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They ambushed Father first, before we did anything to them... It is beyond unforgivable!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Clockwork"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're running out of time. Capollo, we need a plan before Padrino wakes up. Call for reinforcements from the East End. It's risky, but if they don't smell our manpower shortage… we might just make it through.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (No, we shouldn't do that...The Fisalias were keeping an eye on our other territories.)

Dialogues.Speaker: "Capollo"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, we're not doing that. They can take the West End. Our men will retreat to headquarters.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Clockwork"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why? They're tough, but we're no pushovers either! We earned our turf fair and square. Why should we back down now?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Clockwork"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When Padrino eventually wakes, how do you plan to explain that we have let his and the entire family's efforts go to waste?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (But we still risk exposing the location of our headquarters. It's all about predicting their moves... and keeping ours hidden.)

Dialogues.Speaker: "Capollo"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...What about you, Carlotta? What do you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Once again, this deviates from my past experience... Well, I'll point them down the right path this time.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll hit their base.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our people on the East End, the South Second Block, and the dock will stay put to give the impression we know nothing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then we'll send our main forces to where the Fisalias keep their Echoes. The trade routes mean nothing compared to that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As they know what we value most, we need to demand something of equal worth from them as our bargaining chip.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Capollo"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this really going to work?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can't afford to lose our people. Everything else, even the mansion are simply assets.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll cover the rear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
During an attack by Fisalia, Padrino is gravely injured. As senior members like Capollo gather to devise a plan, for the first time, they turn to Carlotta for advice. She seizes the moment to voice what she couldn't on that fateful day, "hit Fisalia's base."
Carlotta proposes evacuating the exposed headquarters while launching an offensive against Fisalia's key locations, volunteering to stay behind and cover the retreat.

Chapters.Title: Defeat the enemies to cover the family forces

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow, look at you with your brilliant plan. So clever. It could have saved us from our humiliating defeat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And of course, you didn't just come up with it because you knew what happened... No, that idea has been brewing in your mind since that very day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How does it feel to finally have your dismissed plan validated?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back then... No one bothered to ask for your input, did they? The big shots like Capollo and those old timers couldn't care less.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The family ended up making the worst possible choice. They called for reinforcements, depleting resources in both headquarters and the East End.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Duncan"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, Cynthia! Look at me, please... Why is this happening? The West End... It's all my fault. I should've been more careful...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Duncan"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're the only family I have left... "The Montelli's motto is Enterprise," huh... But there's no end to this enterprise, no end to the ambition, no end to chasing wealth…

Dialogues.Speaker: "Duncan"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How much more do we have to lose?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the end, your dear grandfather had to step in and fix the mess you all made. The plan advanced, but the dead were forever gone. It stands as the greatest tragedy in our family's history.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With that blood debt haunting you, you became the sharpest blade, working harder than ever to protect the family's interests.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And Capollo... Did he think of seeking the Order's protection after that? When it became painfully clear that his power alone couldn't secure his ambitions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come to think of it, what's so wrong with that? Sacrifices are inevitable, and someone must bear the burden.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By doing so, the family's interests can be preserved. Is this not the balance you wish to maintain?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You were never meant to make decisions for the family. Do you really have what it takes to reshape the order of things?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No matter what you say, I must... stop him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why? Didn't I just show you a better future than what you face now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Merely an illusion of your making! My choices may have altered the outcome, but it's impossible to prove now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The past is set in stone. We only have one path before us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, the cold rain from that night still haunts us. But we cannot be shackled by the past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I might not be in charge, but my principles are clear. Every action I take is for the benefit of the family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I must leave here and stop Capollo. Whatever the consequence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... You're unshakable, aren't you? So you've made up your mind already?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our negotiations have reached a dead end. Then I'll need to try something else to make you stay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Reality is completely different—no one listened to Carlotta's opinions that day. The family's wrong decision led to the tragic fall of the headquarters. Duncan lost his last family member, and Padrino was left to hold the family together despite his injuries.
Now, Carlotta's mirror self reveals the harsh truth: she has never been trusted to lead.
Tempted by an illusory perfect future, Carlotta steels herself against the deception, resolved to stop Capollo.
Her defiance enrages the mirror self, who then traps her in an endless labyrinth.

Chapters.Title: Choose a path to leave the maze

Dialogues.Speaker: "Capollo"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Left! You should've gone left! Wait... Or maybe not?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Capollo"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Think it over, I told you before. You should take the easier way out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wrong, wrong again... Do you really think you can choose the right path?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stay, let's get lost in this maze together, from one window to another… I'll keep your company..

Dialogues.Speaker: "La Llorona"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you truly think you are worthy of the Montelli name?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Backwindow"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just give up... What an embarrassing sight. It's so painful to watch.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Backwindow"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You might have another chance up ahead. Don't disappoint us, okay?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Juniper"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, that's right... Keep moving forward, you're getting close.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Juniper"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have to press ahead. Don't doubt yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Clockwork"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't you see? This is what happens when you choose the wrong path and back the wrong horse!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Clockwork"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The cost... will be far greater than you thought. Why do you always end up on the losing team?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Francesco"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, not this way, piccolina. You should try another way...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Francesco"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Choose wisely. You still have a chance to make things right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The choices seem endless, yet you suddenly notice a path that has never been taken—not left, not right, but something entirely different—

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Turn back, back to where you started, just like rediscovering your original self.

Chapters.Title: Head to the "End" of the maze

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why are you...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was worried you might be in danger.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Also, I'm here to deliver this.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The gun was always there. You earned the right to use it the moment you chose to act on your own accord.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like you've made up your mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Concerned for Carlotta's safety, you enter the mirror as well and hand her the gun that Francesco entrusted to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Padrino's gun never leaves his side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If he places it within your reach,

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: it can only mean one thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've been entrusted with the authority to act

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: in the name of Montelli.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whether it fires, and where it aims...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The choice is mine alone!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am merely a blade made for killing. Am I really qualified to change the status quo?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Capollo"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why won't you obey my orders!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Francesco"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm getting old. We should take the easier approach.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Duncan"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we can make other people pay the price...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why can't you just give in to me and stay here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did you let go of confusion and doubt so easily? Those were your true feelings..

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta's Mirror Self
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and I... What makes us so different?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, care for a story?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A story about why a certain girl was adopted.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
As Carlotta's mirror self begins to fade, she desperately questions the real Carlotta about what makes them different.
Carlotta, however, silently walks past her and joins your side, beginning to share the beginning of her story with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Prayer alone

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Offers no salvation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the face of survival,

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Creed becomes meaningless.

Dialogues.Speaker: Child II
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: H-how dare she eat the tribute...

Dialogues.Speaker: Child I
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nanny always said

Dialogues.Speaker: Child I
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The food is for tribute,

Dialogues.Speaker: Child I
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: it's not for eating!

Dialogues.Speaker: Child III
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're a bad girl...

Dialogues.Speaker: Child III
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm telling Nanny!

Dialogues.Speaker: Child III
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stop!

Dialogues.Speaker: Child I
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Catch her!

Dialogues.Speaker: Nanny
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who would have thought

Dialogues.Speaker: Nanny
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's a Montelli after all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nanny
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The hall is in chaos,

Dialogues.Speaker: Nanny
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet she clings to her weapon...

Dialogues.Speaker: Nanny
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a monster!

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This suits a Montelli well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Repurposing decoration into a weapon,

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Defying indoctrination

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To chart the course forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her blood runs with the same fierce will as ours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come with me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The family will shield you

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And open your eyes to a new world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You will rise to become...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A true Montelli.

Chapters.Title: Leave the Sonoro of the mirror

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You tell Carlotta what you learned from the recovered Terminal data.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see... so Duncan was in the dark about the real cause of Benett's death. He simply wanted to protect his friend's reputation, and Capollo used that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Duncan gave us a rigged Terminal to cover Benett's "debt", clearing his name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Capollo couldn't have tampered with the Terminal data himself, or he would have found the information hidden beneath the overwrites. He simply laid a trap at the dock that Benett visited.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can empathize with Duncan, even to some extent Capollo. They are driven by a desire for safety and stability—a tempting future even for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But we will never achieve that by surrendering ourselves to the Order.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From the very beginning, our paths diverged. To yield to them now means giving up even more, and once we lose our grip, we'll no longer have the luxury of refusal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grandfather and the others have already paved the way. I will follow their lead and chart a course towards a brighter tomorrow. For our family, and all of Ragunna.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wealth and power will safeguard our freedom, while freedom, in turn, will nurture wealth and power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Montelli family is set to break the Order's suffocating hold and lead Ragunna towards a wider horizon—embracing Septimont, Huanglong, and other countries. And through it all, we will never forget who we are.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The family exists to accomplish what one cannot and withstand the winds of fate. This is the future I envision for the Montellis.

Options.PlotLineKey: What do you plan to do next?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like I said, we seize control.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An all-out war with the Order isn't a wise move. Rather than blindly tailing Capollo in search of a hidden data module, let's take control and have him come to us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Scarlet Velvet mentioned they need a formal reply, and we can deliver that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, care to help me give them an unforgettable response in two days?

Options.PlotLineKey: We're taking the initiative. I like it.
Have him come to us... That makes things interesting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
It would be unwise to directly confront the Order, but staying passively behind Capollo and aimlessly searching for the core data module isn't a reasonable choice either.
You and Carlotta decide to force Capollo into handing over the item by giving them an unforgettable response in two days.

Chapters.Title: Wait until the scheduled action time (2 days later, 19:00)
Head to the trading hall as planned

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem. Can you hear me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just checking your location, have you reached the spot, my clever accomplice?

Options.PlotLineKey: Everything's going according to plan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perfect. Remember to be stealthy. Scarlet Velvet and my operatives are positioned in all the streets around the venue. Should anything go awry, I'll set Plan B in motion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The venue only has one entrance. I've arranged for a handler to get you in. You'll go in first and then help me slip in without drawing attention.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the family members at the entrance and find a way into the trading hall

Dialogues.Speaker: Bourbon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The upstairs parlor is off-limits, reserved for a private event.

Options.PlotLineKey: We gave you the heads-up before.
Boss wanted a batch of gifts for our business partner.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bourbon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Now that you mentioned it, yes, they did tell me about that. But weren't you supposed to arrive half an hour later?

Options.PlotLineKey: Half an hour is enough for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bourbon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What was that?

Options.PlotLineKey: Oh, I mean, I thought it was good to come here half an hour early.
We can get ready sooner this way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bourbon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You do have a point, but it's a special day. I need to confirm everyone's identity. What's your codename? Show me your token.

Options.PlotLineKey: (A token?... Tsk, I don't have one.)
(Where's the promised handler? He should be here by now...)

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, Tulip! Why are you still standing there? Come here! Boss just asked for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The visitor slyly palms a Tulip coin, hiding the gesture in his shadow. You discreetly accept it and present it as proof of identity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bourbon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, Tulip coin... Oh! I remember you. You work at the vault, don't you? We had a drink at Margherita's.

Options.PlotLineKey: Huh? Uh, well... Yes, it's been awhile!
Don't tell me you've already forgotten me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bourbon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No wonder you arrived early. You people at the vault are always one step ahead.
Yeah, yeah, we can talk after getting the job done. Now hurry up, we'll deliver the gifts together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the help of a mysterious figure, you disguise yourself as a family member delivering a gift for Capollo and successfully escort Carlotta into the venue.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you made it inside?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This area is under surveillance. On either side of the main stage, you should see something that looks like a control panel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Operate it to disable the cameras, then place the "gems" I made with my Forte into position.

Chapters.Title: Search and disable surveillance cameras on both sides of the stage

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did it go? Any issues?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything's fine. Just got to the place we agreed on.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The front of the hall. Done.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Main hall, five o'clock. Done.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Blind spot, done.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back window, done.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The setup is complete, and the time we planned is drawing near.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How's it going on your end?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm out of the mirror, and the jammer's set up. Capollo actually inspired this plan, otherwise we wouldn't have been able to infiltrate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order's agents have taken the bait and are at the location. "Blue Rain" and "Retriever" are primed for action.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll head out at the chime of the hour.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nearly go time. The Order's men should be here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Double-check everything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should talk, Capollo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You? Why are you here?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your guests won't be showing up today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, Carlotta… Looks like you've pieced together the whole story. So it was your crew who tipped us off about changing the time and place for the deal yesterday.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me guess. You fed the same line to the Order, didn't you? Playing both sides, setting yourself up nicely… But something doesn't add up. You couldn't have pulled this off alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Capollo's promises of safety and comfort are nothing but a sham. He has been using our family as pawns, making them pay the ultimate price. Benett was just one of his victims.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He didn't fall at the hands of Tacet Discords but to Capollo himself. His body was disposed of outside the city's limits... The truth is, Benett never betrayed us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The path of the Montelli family is one of unity. We stand together, leaving no one behind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't promise there won't be more losses, but I will prioritize the welfare of every member. I do not take sacrifice lightly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, will you continue down this path? Or will you align with our cause for Bennett's sake and your own?

Dialogues.Speaker: Duncan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Trust built on deception always comes back to haunt you. You're getting what you deserve.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that you've lost both the goods and your trading partners… this is your last chance to bow out gracefully.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bow out gracefully? Do you think I still care about saving face at this point?

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My only regret is not being ruthless enough… I should've cut you loose earlier, making you pay the price like the others who crossed me.

Options.PlotLineKey: You've betrayed your family's ideals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And what of it? You'll never understand!

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We lack the power to protect everyone, so what's wrong with seeking a powerful ally? Why not align ourselves with those who share my true goal?

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …You're right, I've crossed a line. But I can still salvage this if I take you out here and reclaim that data module.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Trust built on deception will eventually be shattered by reality. You, Carlotta, and Duncan, who decided to help you, change the location and time of the deal without Capollo noticing. Even though both the trading partners and cargo are lost, Capollo refuses to back down. The two Montellis, now on different paths, finally arrive at their confrontation. The key to winning this duel lies in the whereabouts of the core data module.

Dialogues.Speaker: Capollo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone, capture them!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time to leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Copy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fall for me, will you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then let's fall together!

Chapters.Title: Bring the data module to a safe place

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Scarlet Velvet's people have secured Duncan and will bring him to a safe house. He'll return after everything's settled.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Regarding the Order, I tasked "Blue Rain" and "Retriever" to pose as Capollo's agents and declare the cooperation null and void.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No data module, no explanation or any follow-up... Capollo is already a lost cause. The Order will realize this soon enough.

Chapters.Title: Bring the data module to a safe place
Bring the data module to a safe place

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The rain's back. I remember telling Grandfather how I hated the rainy season.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I once saw rain as a bad omen in Ragunna.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When it rains, it's easier to wash away blood stains. That's why acts of revenge usually happen on such days.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But today's rain feels different. As it falls, the troubles of yesterday are washed away. I feel calm, like I've found my true self again. My present and my future are now in my own hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well done, Carlotta. And thank you, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My girl could not have accomplished this without your assistance.

Options.PlotLineKey: She personally invited and vouched for me, after all.
She is capable enough in her own right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I had faith in you two, but you surpassed my expectations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It appears I underestimated the potential that you possess when working together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What he just said... Looks like someone has been keeping secrets from me, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've been curious, you entered that Sonoro and delivered his gun to me. How did you earn my grandfather's trust so soon?

Options.PlotLineKey: That's a story between the two of us.
I'll tell you next time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hm, the nerve... Fine, since we make such a good team, I'll let it slide for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Capollo and his lackeys will face the consequences of their actions. Our code is simple—vengeance for blood, death for life. No one is exempt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's a lot at play here. It will require some effort and a true Montelli at my side to handle it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. I'll take care of the rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But before that...

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you leaving?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. What, miss me already?

Options.PlotLineKey: Of course not.
Yes, I'll miss you. Who knows when I'll see you again.
Well... maybe a little.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "No need to feel sad about parting, for each goodbye brings us closer to the next hello."

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's my favorite way to think of it—a countdown to our next reunion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With Capollo ousted, the family needs someone to fill his shoes. I must assist my grandfather through this tumultuous transition. There is no one else to do it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, {PlayerName}. As my grandfather said, things couldn't have gone so smoothly without your help and support.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that the dust has settled, you no longer need to stay with me as Cat's Eye of the Montelli family, but still... I want you to have this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As I said, every member gets a token that matches their codename.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though you already have a pair of Cat's Eyes, please accept this as a token of my appreciation. No, this gem wasn't crafted by my Forte. I chose it just for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know someone like you won't stay just for me, and joining the Montelli family might not be in your plans just yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I'll keep this codename for you, Cat's Eye—the first and only member to receive my personal invitation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
As the evening rain falls, washing away everything from the past, Carlotta tells you that today's rain brings her peace. She has finally found her true self and feels in control of both her present and future.
When the rain stops, Carlotta bids you farewell. To build a new, true Montelli, she needs to handle the aftermath of Capollo's betrayal. Before parting, she hands you a Cat's Eye brooch, telling you that the codename "Cat's Eye" will forever belong to you, as you are the only member she has ever recommended.
